file_content.text: I'm just going to lie low for a bit. Until the Republic's forgotten about me.
Your virus is in.
I know! I just got a call from my employer. He told me they've already found plans for a Republic strike on Hoth.
This is my fee here, every last credit. You've earned it.
But in the future, I'm sticking to jobs I can do from the safety of my own home.
Plant the virus in the Republic HoloNet's broadcast tower. Hurry.
Psst. Stay low and try not to let any blaster bolts hit you.
The Empire needs you. I need you. Long live the Emperor, right?
I don't plan on letting him live too long.
Until I kill him.
And then you'd be the Emperor, right? So long live the Emperor.
Are you going to offer me a job or not?
Get to the point.
Uh, right, I was just getting to that.
Long live the Emperor.
Indeed.
I knew it! I knew you were a true Imperial. You can always tell.
May he grow in strength and power.
May he be unstoppable.
Yes, good one, yes. Strength and power. That's good.
What are you talking about?
You've been taking too many stims.
A little jittery, aren't you?
Oh no, that's just adrenaline. The natural kind. Fear, mainly.
I'm the best in the business, see. The business being slicing. In this case, slicing top secret Republic military databanks on the Empire's payroll.
Thing is, Network Access is self-contained. You can't slice it remotely. And... I'm not so good at the physical breaking and entering.
Is that a roundabout way of asking me to get you in there?
You need help?
Oh, I got in. Briefly. Then I ran like there was a randy rancor after me.
If the Republic caught you, why are you still alive?
You got caught?
Because I also happen to be really good at running. And hiding.
Hurry it up.
Fine. I got caught. I ran. I'm here.
But now every murdering droid in Net Access has my picture and a kill order.
The Empire's already paid for the job, so if I fail, I'm dead. But if I go back, I'm just as dead.
You took a mission from the Empire. You must complete it.
That's no excuse for failure.
But I have! I mean, I did what they hired me for.
Why tell me this?
This data spike contains a virus I wrote that'll open a channel into the Republic's data nets.
I'll give you everything the Empire paid me--just get past those killer droids and plant the virus. Please, I've got no one else.
You should be killed for your failure.
I won't help. [Refuse quest.]
Please, no! I did what they wanted. I tried!
I'm under a little fire right now.
